She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo, and beverages.

Antonietta has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, and beverages.

loans.name: Reyna Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Reyna del Carmen” en la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que funciona el banco comunal y está muy bien organizado. Este banco comunal está conformado por diez personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de comida, gas para cocinar, zapatos, artesanía y otros se dedican a brindar servicios. 

(La señora Livia está levantando la mano en la fotografía). La señora Livia nació en la ciudad de Puno en el departamento de Puno pero vive en la encantadora ciudad del Cusco, tiene 27 años de edad, tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos. Su actividad económica principal de la socia Livia es la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar y otras cosas.  En esta oportunidad Livia requiere el préstamo para comprar al por mayor pues le sale más barato por lo tanto comprará sacos de azúcar, sacos de arroz, cajas de leche y otras cosas más que faltan en el negocio. Su anhelo de la socia Livia es tener una tienda propia y que sus hijos se han profesionales. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas. Cusco se caracteriza por ser una zona turística, por sus centros arqueológicos, por su centro histórico, por sus paisajes, por su historia, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 
(El socio que aperece en la parte inferior de la fotografia llego tarde a la reunion).
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends have formed the “Reyna del Carmen” Communal Bank in the town of Cusco. This Communal Bank has been working for a few years already, and it is well organized. This Communal Bank is composed of ten people who are constantly looking for chances to get ahead, and to offer a better future to their children thanks to their daily efforts. Some of the economic activities of the members are: food sale, cooking gas sale, shoes sale and handicrafts, while others engages in providing services of different kind.

Livia (who is the one with her hand raised in the picture) was born in Puno, a town of the Puno department, but she live in the lovely city of Cusco. She is 27 years old, she lives in a common-law marriage and she has two children. Her main economic activity is selling basic necessities such as rice and sugar among other things. In this occasion Livia is asking for a loan to buy products at wholesale price, being it cheaper for her to do so. She will buy bags of sugar, bags of rice, milk boxes and other products she needs in her shop. Livia’s goal is to run her own shop and that her children can become professionals.

All the members arte grateful for the chance they have been offered, and they commit to complying with the repayment of their dues according to the set schedule.

Cusco is located in the district and province of Cusco, in the heart of the ancient Incan town. Cusco is a tourist area, renowned for its archeological sites, its historical center, its landscapes, its history, for Inti Raymi, a traditional celebration, and because here on can visit “Machupicchu”, one of the seven wonders of the world.

(One member appears in the lower part of the picture because he arrived late at the meeting).
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Reyna del Carmen

loans.use: To buy bags of sugar, bags of rice and milk boxes.

loans.name: Hamid

texts.en:
Hamid is a 47-year-old married man and father of six children. He has been working in agriculture for the past 30 years. Hamid is a hard worker and well-known in the region.
In 2002, Hamid started his own business, and he is very proud he took this step. Hamid is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to buy a tractor necessary to expand his business.
This is Hamid's second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, with a good standing in his pay back history. Hamid rents a tractor to plow his land, and through this loan he will be able to increase his income by saving on his rental expenses.

loans.use: to buy a tractor

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El Comité Nueva Esperanza, es de la Ciudad de Caaguazú, actualmente estan en cuarto ciclo, es un grupo conformado por señoras humildes muy trabajadoras que luchan dia a dia para sobresalir adelante. Ellas decidierón formar un grupo solidario, donde trabajan en equipo donde la  responsabilidad  es un factor muy importante y cada una posee un trabajo independiente en donde la Fundación Paraguaya les brinda y les da la oportunidad de superacion personal y familiar.
La Presidenta del Grupo es la Sra. Maria, ella se dedica a la venta de materiales electronicos, repuestos para celulares, radios y televisores, nos comenta también que su marido la ayuda en su negocio.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para celulares, radios y televisores, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con los pedidos Es una señora muy activa y responsable y agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo que brinda a las señoras que tienen ganas de superarse.
texts.en:
The Comité Nueva Esperanza (new hope committee) is from the city of Caaguazú. They are currently in their fourth loan cycle. The group is comprised of humble, hardworking women who fight day-to-day in order to come out ahead. They decided to form a mutually supportive group and to work as a team—so responsibility is a very important factor. Each member has independent work which the Fundación Paraguaya helps support, giving them the opportunity to surmount barriers both personal and familial.

Maria is the president of the group. She makes her living selling electronic equipment, including spare parts for cell phones, radios, and televisions. She also tells us that her husband helps her in the business.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy spare parts for cell phones, radios, and televisions. With these, she will be able to stock up and to satisfy her clients' requests. She is a very active and responsible woman and is grateful to the Fundación Paraguaya for the support that it affords women who want to overcome the obstacles they face.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for cell phones, radios, and televisions

loans.name: Manuel Alexander

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de estado civil conviviente, tiene dos hijos de 2 y 8 años de edad.  vive con su familia en el caserío Sincape del distrito de Olmos – Lambayeque, la  comunidad campesina cuenta con 150 casas aproximadamente, teniendo los servicios de luz y agua, además de contar con iglesia y colegio.
Manuel se dedica principalmente al comercio de animales y cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, durante la semana compra ganado y lo vende los días viernes en la ciudad de Chiclayo, los animales que suele comercializar son ovinos, caprinos, aves de corral, cuyes, conejos y chanchos. Manuel  además tiene animales de crianza. al momento de  la evaluación se le encontró cuyes, y chanchos comprados durante el fin de semana;  adicionalmente, en sus tiempos libres trabaja en su mototaxi, cubriendo la ruta Sincape- Olmos y viceversa.

El monto solicitado del  crédito es de 3,000 nuevos soles y será para invertirlo en la compra de ganado para engorde, específicamente ovinos y caprinos, estima comprarlos pequeños y sacarlos a la venta dentro de 4 meses,  ya que en olmos por las lluvias abunda el pasto y el costo de crianza es cero, y de esta manera le va permitir mejorar su condición de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel is in a common law marriage and has two children, ages 2 and 8.  He lives with his family in the village of Sincape in the district of Olmos, province of Lambayeque.  The country community has about 150 houses with electricity and water services.  In addition, they have a church and a school.  

Manuel works mainly in the marketing of animals and has ten years of experience in this business.  During the week, he buys cattle and sells it on Fridays in the city of Chiclayo. The animals that he usually sells are sheep, goats, poultry, guinea pigs, rabbits, and pigs.  Manuel also raises animals.  At the time of the evaluation, he had bought guinea pigs and pigs during the weekend.  In addition, during his spare time, Manuel drives a motorcycle taxi, covering the route from Sincape-Olmos and back.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000 nuevos soles and will invest it in the purchase of cattle to fatten, specifically sheep and goats.  Due to the rain in Olmos, there is abundant grass so the cost of raising animals is zero. For this reason, he estimates purchasing them small and taking them to market within four months.  In this way, he will improve living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle, sheep, and goats to fatten.

loans.name: Llapanchis Tticarisunchis Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Llapanchis Tticarisunchis” en la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que funciona el banco comunal y está muy bien organizado. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de comida, gas para cocinar, zapatos, artesanía y otros se dedican a brindar servicios. 

(La señora Diana está levantando la mano en la fotografía). La señora Diana nació en la ciudad de Quillabamba de la provincia de la La Convención del departamento del cusco pero vive en la encantadora ciudad del Cusco, tiene 25 años de edad, tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo. Su actividad económica principal de la socia Diana es la venta de ropa de segundo uso especialmente ropa Americana. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Diana requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo pantalones, zapatillas, chompas, camisas, faldas, casacas  y otras cosas más.  

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.

(Las personas que aparecen en la parte inferior de la fotografía llegaron tarde a la reunión).

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas. Cusco se caracteriza por ser una zona turística, por sus centros arqueológicos, por su centro histórico, por sus paisajes, por su historia, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends have formed the “Llapanchis Tticarisunchis” Communal Bank in the town of Cusco. This Communal Bank has been working for a few years already, and it is well organized. This Communal Bank is composed of people who are constantly looking for chances to get ahead, and to offer a better future to their children thanks to their daily efforts. Some of the economic activities of the members are: food sale, cooking gas sale, shoes sale and handicrafts, while others engages in providing services of different kind.

Diana (who is the one with her hand raised in the picture) was born in Quillabamba, a town of the La Convención province in the Cusco department, but she live in the lovely city of Cusco. She is 25 years old, she lives in a common-law marriage and she has one child. Her main economic activity is selling used clothes, American used clothes in particular. She has been engaged in this activity for a few years already, and things are going very well thanks to the dedication she works with. In this occasion Diana is requesting a loans to buy products such as trousers, slippers, sweaters, shirts, skirts and zip jackets among other things.

All the members are grateful for the chance they have been offered, and they commit to complying with the repayment of their dues according to the set schedule.

(Two people appear in the lower parts of the picture because they have arrived late at the meeting).

Cusco is located in the district and province of Cusco, in the heart of the ancient Incan town. Cusco is a tourist area, renowned for its archeological sites, its historical center, its landscapes, its history, for Inti Raymi, a traditional celebration, and because here on can visit “Machupicchu”, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: To buy trousers, slippers, sweaters, shirts, skirts and zip jackets.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with eight children. 

Benedicta has a shop where she buys and sells bananas and different kinds of vegetables. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy additional stock of bananas and vegetables like pechay and cabbage.

Benedicta has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Benedicta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and vegetables like pechay and cabbage.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 46 years old and married with four children. With one of the kids in school, Marissa works very hard to provide for them.

Marissa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Marissa has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, bread and other groceries. 

In the future, Marissa would like to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. 

Rene has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where he buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. He had this business for five years. He requested a loan for 4,000 PHP to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, charcoal, copra & beverages.

Rene has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Rene hopes to improve his business for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, charcoal, copra and beverages

loans.name: Union San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Unión San  Jerónimo” en la ciudad del Cusco. Ya es un año que funciona el banco comunal y está muy bien organizado. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de comida, muebles, abarrotes, cosméticos y otros se dedican a brindar servicios.  

(La socia Sadid está levantando la mano en la fotografía). La socia Sadid nació en el distrito Cusco del departamento Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, tiene 19 años de edad y es soltera. Sadid trabaja en una empresa privada de trasportes en el área de secretariado. Ya son cuatro meses que trabaja en dicha empresa y le va muy bien. Sadid los domingos trabaja en uno de los mercados más populares de la ciudad del Cuco vendiendo productos de primera necesidad. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Sadid requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería por mayor como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar y sacos de arroz.
  
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas. Cusco se caracteriza por ser una zona turística, por sus centros arqueológicos, por su centro histórico, por sus paisajes, por su historia, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the "Unión San Jerónimo” communal bank in the city of Cusco. The communal bank has been operating for a year now, and it is very well organized. This communal bank is made up of people who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead and provide a better future for their children with their daily efforts. The members' economic activities include, for example, selling food, furniture and cosmetics, while others dedicate themselves to providing services. 

(The member Sadid is raising her hand in the photograph.) Sadid was born in the district of Cusco, department of Cusco, and she lives in the same city where she was born. She is 19 years old and single. Sadid works in a private transport company, in the secretarial office. She has worked for this company for four months now, and it is going very well for her. On Sundays, Sadid works at one of the most popular markets of the city of Cusco, selling basic grocery products. She has sold groceries for four years, and it is going very well for her, thanks to the dedication she puts into her work. 

At this time, Sadid needs the loan to buy merchandise on a wholesale basis, such as sacks of sugar and sacks of rice. All of the members are grateful for the opportunity provided to them, and they are committed to making their various loan payments on schedule.

Cusco is located in the district and province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco, at the very heart of the ancient city of the Incas. Cusco is known as a tourist attraction thanks to its archaeological centers, its historic city center, its landscapes, its history, and its traditional festival of Inti Raymi, and because one of the seven wonders of the world, Machu Picchu, is found here.

loans.use: to buy wholesale merchandise such as sacks of sugar and sacks of rice.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Joseph has a store where he sells rice and gasoline. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy additional stock of rice and gasoline.

Joseph has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Joseph hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of rice and gasoline.

loans.name: Nova

texts.en:
Nova is married with one child. Nova is 43 years old.

Nova sells hotdogs, chorizo and longganiza to earn a living.  She has had this business for five years.  Nova has requested a loan to buy additional stocks of hotdog, chorizo and longganiza.

Nova has been a member of HSPFI for three years. In the future, Nova hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of hotdog, chorizo and longganiza.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy various mobile phones for resale.

loans.name: Razac's Group

texts.en:
Razac's group is comprised of two hard working women. Razac is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda. For the past two years, Razac has been working hard to manage her small business selling clothes. 

To help expand her business, Razac has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale and will help Razac to generate greater profits and pay house rent and other expenses at home like buying food. Razac hopes that in the future, she will be able to own a shopping mall. 

Razac is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Razac's future prospects by helping her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale,

loans.name: Lelani

texts.en: Lelani is 39 years old and is married with 4 children. She makes food and snacks like rice cakes to earn a living and has had this business for 4 years. Lelani has requested a loan to buy ingredients for making snacks like rice cakes. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Lelani hopes to improve her business for the better.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making snacks like rice cakes.

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.es:
La señora Vicentina tiene 37 años de edad, es conviviente y no tiene hijos. Ella se dedica al comercio de verduras y tubérculos en Huaypetue distrito de la provincia de Puerto Maldonadado – Perú. Vicentina lleva sus productos para comercializarlos en esta región del Perú, debido al crecimiento de la población por la minería informal, actividad que ha surgido en esta deprimida zona del país, y además porque sus productos son bien cotizados por el difícil acceso a este poblado.

En esta ocasión Vicentina solicita un préstamo para poder comprar mercadería y venderla en Huaypetue, Ella espera que trabajando mucho en este comercio pueda terminar de construir su casa.

Vicentina pertenece al banco comunal  “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de Andahuaylillas, provincia de Quispicanchis Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: Vicentina is 37 years old, lives with her partner and has no children. She makes a living selling vegetables and tubercules in Huaypetue, district of Puerto Maldonado province - Perú. Vicentina brings her products to sell them in this region of Perú, because of the growth in population due to the informal mining industry, activity which has come up in this depressed area of the country, and also because her products are highly sought-after because it is a hard-to-reach town. This time Vicentina asks for a loan that will allow her to purchase merchandise and sell it in Huaypetue. She hopes that by working hard in this commercial activity she will be able to finish the construction of her house. Vicentina belongs to “Las Triunfadoras” communal bank of the Andahuaylillas district, province of Quispicanchis Cusco – Perú.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mae

texts.en:
Mae is 39 years old, single and lives in the Philippines.
 
Mae has a shop where she buys and sells scrap materials. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 4,000 PHP for additional capital to buy scrap materials such as used bottles and plastics.

Mae has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Mae hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy scrap materials like empty bottles and used plastics

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: Bilal is a 22-year-old single man who has been working in mobile phone sales and maintenance for three years. In 2010, he opened his own shop and it's going just fine. Bilal is a hard worker with a good reputation. Bilal is applying for a Youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary tools and mobile accessories. Bilal will also invest part of the loan in increasing the mobile prepaid cards and he might buy a TV for the shop. Bilal is also thinking of buying a special International call machine necessary for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy tools, phone accessories and prepaid cards to sell

loans.name: Ruth Filomena

texts.es:
La señora Filomena tiene 45 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, dos de los cuales dependen de ella. 
Filomena nació en Quincemil pero vive en Andahuaylillas ambas en la  provincia de Quispicanchis en Cusco - Perú 

Su actividad principal de Filomena es la crianza y comercialización de animales menores tales como gallinas y pollos. Su comercio lo realiza en el distrito de Quincemil, para ello, ella tiene que movilizarse desde el Cusco hasta su destino durante 6 horas aproximadamente.

Filomena necesita de un crédito para comprar mas  pollos y gallinas para venderlos en Quincemil y asi seguir construyendo su casita.
Filomena pertenece al banco comunal  “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de Andahuaylillas, provincia de Quispicanchis Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Filomena is 45 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children, two of which are supported by her. Filomena was born in Quincemil, but lives in Andahuaylillas - both places are the province of Quispicanchis in Cusco, Peru. 

Filomena's primary activity is raising and selling small animals like hens and chickens. She does her business in the district of Quincemil, and to do it she has to travel from Cusco to her destination, which takes about 6 hours. 

Filomena needs a loan to buy more chickens and hens to sell in Quincemil, to be able to continue building her small home. Filomena belongs to the community bank "Las Triunfadoras" [The Winners] of the Andahuaylillas district, Quispicanchis province in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy more chickens and hens.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 45 years old and married with four children. She buys plastic bottles, twine, rope and other recycled materials to earn a living. She has had this business for three years. Each month, Gemma earns 3,000 Philippine pesos doing this type of work. Gemma has requested a loan to buy stock of recycled materials like plastic bottles.

Gemma has been a member of HSPFI for two years. In the future, Gemma hopes to make changes in her business for the better.

loans.use: to buy stock of recycled materials like plastic bottles.

loans.name: Villamor

texts.en: Villamor is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines where he is married and has four children. Villamor provides motorela (or motorcycle) services. He has had this business for 4 years. He requested a loan for 7,000 to buy tools and gasoline for his business. Villamor has been a member of HSPFI since 2012, and in the future, he hopes to improve his business to help with his children's education.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and maintenance tools for his motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Hasifah

texts.en:
Hasifah's group is comprised of hard-working women. Hasifah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Hasifah has been working hard to manage her small tailoring business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Hasifah has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more material for making clothes for resale, and it will help Hasifah generate greater profits and pay her own school fees. Hasifah hopes that in the future she will be able to own a retail shop. 

Hasifah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Hasifah's future prospects by helping her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more material for her small tailoring business

loans.name: Wenifreda

texts.en: Wenifreda works hard to support her family. Wenifreda is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines; she's been in the business for 20 years. She requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and other equipment. In the future, Wenifreda would like to build and expand her business so that her family has more financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Feluche

texts.en:
Feluche is married with six children. Feluche is 38 years old.

Feluche sells and buys coconuts and bananas to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Feluche has requested a loan to buy stocks of coconuts and bananas.

Feluche has been a member of HSPFI for three years. In the future, Feluche hopes to improve her business for the better.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Regina has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 4,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Regina has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Regina hopes to improve her business to be able to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is married with two children. Esterlita is 44 years old.

Esterlita sells dried fish to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Esterlita has requested a loan to buy additional stocks of dried fish.

Esterlita has been a member of HSPFI for two years. In the future, Esterlita hopes to improve her business for the better.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of dried fish.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 51 años de  edad, de estado civil conviviente, cuenta con 2 hijos menores  de edad, vive con sus hijos y  cónyuge, la calidad de vida en la comunidad es de subsistencia la mayoría son trabajadores independientes en negocios de comercio y crianza de animales adicionalmente dedicados a la  agricultura; su domicilio está  ubicado en  el caserío La capilla san Antonio- Sialupe Baca de la provincia de Lambayeque.


La actividad comercial es la  crianza de  animales  menores y la venta de chicha de jora, cuenta con 25 años de  experiencia  en dicha actividad, el negocios  está ubicado en su propio domicilio, cuenta con clientela fija que son los comerciantes  de Chiclayo. 
El monto solicitado del préstamo  es de 2000 nuevos soles  y será para invertirlo en la compra de animales  y compra de alimentos para engorde de ganado porcino; actualmente  se ha propuesto ampliar su inventario en lo referente ha animales debido a que es una actividad muy rentable en la zona.
texts.en:
José is a 51 years old man, has 2 minor children, lives together with his children and his partner. The standard of living of his community is one of subsistence, most people are independent workers in commerce related businesses and raising of animals, also dedicated to agriculture; his home is located in the La capilla San Antonio- Sialupe Baca neighborhood in the Lambayeque province.

His commercial activity is the raising of small animals and the sale of corn liquor, he has 25 years of experience doing this. The business is located in his own home and has a regular customer base, which is made up of the Chiclayo storekeepers.

The loan amount requested is of 2000 nuevos soles and it will be invested in the purchase of animals and the purchase of food for the fattening of pigs; currently he has set out to broaden his inventory in what refers to animals because it is a very profitable activity in the area.

loans.use: to purchase animals and food for the fattening of pigs

loans.name: Yasser

texts.en:
Yasser is a 40-year-old married man and father of four children. He has worked in the air-conditioning business since 1995. His business is going just fine but its highest season starts in the spring and continues until the end of summer. Yasser is a hard working man who does his best for his family's happiness and good living.

Yasser is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a Renault Rapid car to transport his tools and machines safely from one place to another.

This is Yasser's 11th loan with Al Majmoua and all his previous loans helped a lot in improving and expanding his business. At the same time, he has an impressive history in paying back the loans.

Yasser is planning to open an accessories and maintenance shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy a Renault Rapid car to transport tools and machinery

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Martha de 38  años de edad es originaria de León, realizo estudios superiores en contabilidad, madre de 3 hijos los cuales tiene a su cargo. Ella  además de tener una profesión es comerciante se dedica a la venta de ropa y accesorios como recordatorios, ramos, coronas, zapatos y sombreros todo lo que se utiliza en las fiestas de quince años, primera comunión y bautismos actividad en la que tiene más de catorce años  de experiencia y dominio. Inicio su actividad como ayudante de costura luego se asocio con otra persona pero con el tiempo está enfermo y ella decidió seguir sola en el negocio, no cuenta con el apoyo de una persona que le ayude pues saca su negocio adelante por si misma comercializando sus productos en toda la zona de la comunidad de León. Su expectativa es seguir comercializando sus productos para atraer más clientes, cuenta  con los ingresos de su compañero de vida quien trabaja por su cuenta y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar.
Solicita el préstamo para compra de materiales tales como telas, hilo de tejer, encajes para vestidos, sombreros y productos típicos para exhibir en su tienda con el objetivo de aumentar su inventario para obtener mejores ganancias, como planes futuros espera seguir comercializando sus productos, surtirlos con variados productos hasta llegar a ser líder en el negocio.
texts.en:
Martha, 38, is from León.  She is the mother of three children, for whom she is responsible.  She completed advanced studies in accounting.

In addition to being a storekeeper she works selling clothing and accessories such as printed cards, bouquets, crowns, shoes, and hats, everything used in parties for "quinceañeras" [coming-of-age parties for 15-year-old girls], First Communions, and baptisms.  She has more than 14 years of experience and knowledge in this activity.

She began her work as a sewing assistant.  Then she became partners with another person who, in time, got sick, so she decided to continue in the business by herself.  She does not have help from anyone, so she gets her business ahead by herself, selling her products in the whole area of the community of León.  Her expectation is to continue selling her products to attract more customers.  She has the income of her life partner, who works on his own and helps her with the household expenses.

She is requesting the loan to buy materials such as fabric, thread, lace for dresses, hats, and traditional products to display in her store, with the goal of increasing her inventory to get better profits.

In the future she hopes to continue selling her products, stocking up with various products until she becomes a leader in the business.

loans.use: to buy materials such as fabric, thread, lace for dresses, hats, and traditional products.

loans.name: Manulita

texts.en:
Manulita is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.
 
Manulita has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 16,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo & beverages.

Manulita has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Manulita hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages to sell

loans.name: Niño Salvador Del Mundo Group

texts.es:
El grupo niño salvador del mundo es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo,  está integrado por 12 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Ellas vieron una gran oportunidad de crecimiento en el programa de la fundación paraguaya y desean poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
Benedicta forma parte del grupo, y ella misma nos comenta que tiene una  despensa bien surtida, con la cual surte a las personas de su barrio y de las zonas aledañas. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora y tiene como meta seguir creciendo como microempresaria.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, bebidas, panificados, verduras y demás insumos necesarios para poder seguir manteniendo bien surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
The Niño Salvador del Mundo group is from the city of San Lorenzo.  It is made up of 12 women, all of them friends and neighbors in that city.  They saw a great opportunity for growth in Fundación Paraguaya's program, and they want to be able to reach the highest level of the program.

Benedicta is part of the group, and she herself tells us that she has a well-stocked store with which she supplies the people in her neighborhood and other nearby areas.  She is a very hardworking and enterprising person.  She has a goal to keep growing as a micro-entrepreneur.

She is requesting the loan to buy meat, beverages, bread, vegetables, and other supplies necessary to be able to continue keeping her business well stocked.

loans.use: to buy meat, beverages, bread, vegetables, and other supplies.

loans.name: Luis Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo es un hombre soltero, vive en casa de sus padres la cual esta ubicada en el caserío Wiracocha del distrito de Tambogrande.
La actividad que desarrolla  Gustavo es la crianza de ganado de  ovino y aves de corral, en la parte posterior de su domicilio, teniendo actualmente 12 cabezas de ganado ovino y 15 aves de corral (gallinas, pavos), los cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local. Además cuenta con 1,0 has de terreno agrícola sembrado de cultivo de limón en producción que cosecha semanalmente.
El monto solicitado del  crédito será de 2000 nuevos soles y será para invertirlo en  la compra de alimentos balanceados para el engorde de ovinos, aves y  mejoras en el corral, esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gustavo is single, and lives with his parents in the Caserío Wiracocha community in the district of Tambogrande.

Gustavo works raising cattle, sheep and barnyard fowl behind his house. He has 12 head of cattle and sheep, and 15 birds (chickens and turkeys), and he raises all of his animals to grow them and fatten them up for resale in the local market. He also has one hectare of arable land that is planted with lemon trees and is harvested weekly.

He is requesting this loan of 2,000 nuevos soles in order to purchase healthy feed for his animals and birds, and to repair his corrals. This investment will help him to continue growing his business and improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase healthy feed for his animals and repair his corral.

loans.name: Luzveña

texts.es:
Luzveña es una joven emprendedora, con apenas 21 años de edad, se dedica al comercio de animales menores como gallinas, cuyes entre otros. Luzveña es conciente que adicionalmente a su actividad debe seguir estudiando, así que trabaja duro para continuar estudios superiores.

En esta oportunidad Luzveña solicita un préstamo para comprar más animales y aumentar su movimiento comercial e ingresos. Ella espera en un futuro cercano, poder construir su casa en el terreno que su padre le dio.

Luzveña pertenece al Banco comunal “Las Triunfadoras” del distrito de Andahuaylillas, provincia de Quispicanchis Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Luzveña is an enterprising young woman.  At hardly 21 years old, she works in business, selling small animals including chickens, guinea pigs, and others.  Luzveña is conscious that in addition to her work, she must continue studying.  Thus, she works hard to continue her higher education.

At this opportunity, Luzveña requests a loan to purchase more animals and increase her commercial movement and income.  She hopes that in the near future, she will be able to construct her home on the land her father gave her.

Luzveña belongs to the communal bank “Las Triunfadoras” in the Andahuaylillas district in the province of Quispicanchis Cusco – Perú.

loans.use: to purchase more animals and increase her commercial movement.

loans.name: Santos Bernabe

texts.es:
Santos es una mujer de 40 años de edad, casado, sin hijos. Vive en casa propia con su esposo que es jornalero y lo apoya con la canasta familiar, Santos vive en el caserío El Carmen, comunidad ubicada en la margen izquierda del distrito de tambogrande. Ya cuentan con algunos servicios básicos como luz eléctrica.
La actividad que desarrolla la Santos es la crianza de ovinos, caprinos y aves de corral como actividad principal ya que cuenta con 20 cabezas de ganado ovino, 30 cabras. Se dedica a la crianza hace aproximadamente más de 5 años. 
El monto solicitado del crédito es de 1500 nuevos soles y será invertido en  la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y mejoras en el corral de los mismos. Para eso cliente cuenta con los conocimientos para la adecuada alimentación de los animales.
texts.en:
Santos is 40 years old, and is married with no children. She and her husband live in their own house, and he works as a day laborer in a grocery store. Santos lives in the El Carmen community, which is located on the left edge of the Tambogrande district. She and her husband have access to some basic amenities, such as electricity.

Santos works raising animals, such as sheep, goats and barnyard fowl. She has 20 head of sheep and 30 head of goats, and has been raising animals for over five years.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500 nuevos soles so that she can invest in the purchase of healthy feed for her animals and in repairs for her corrals. She has a good understanding of animal nutrition and feeding schedules.

loans.use: to purchase healthy feed for her animals and to repair her corrals.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is married with three children. He is 42 years old and he sells coconuts to earn a living. William has had this business for three years and has been a member of HSPFI for 2 years. He has requested a loan to to buy inventory of coconuts to sell. In the future, William hopes to improve his business to give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy inventory of coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Violeto

texts.en:
Violeto is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single and has two children. Violeto owns a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of 7000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo, and beverages.
Violeto has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Violeto hopes to improve his business for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, shampoo, soap, and beverages

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 44 years old and married with one child in school, Rosemarie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosemarie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Rosemarie has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, spices, noodles, eggs, etc. 

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 45 years old and married with four children currently in school, Rosie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosie runs a general stores in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Rosie has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, sugar, spices, soap, shampoo, etc. 

In the future, Rosie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Saadiya

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 41 years old, married and has two children.

Saadiya has owned a beauty salon since 2000. She offers haircuts for women, treatment for faces, hands and feet. She has good experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is well known in the surrounding areas.

She applied for a $1500 loan in order to purchase an electrical generator. She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase an electrical generator.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es una mujer de 37 años de edad, conviviente, con 02 hijos dependientes, vive en casa propia en el PPJJ Las Dunas del Distrito de Lambayeque. Clienta tiene crédito vigente solo con nuestra entidad
La actividad que realiza la Margarita es brindar servicio de costura sobre medidas en un taller que funciona en su domicilio. Clienta posee una máquina de coser artesanal y 01 remalladora que adquirió con el último crédito que le brindo nuestra entidad. Clienta es conocida en su zona, tiene clientela fidelizada. Su Cónyuge de clienta se desempeña con guardián de la  Ugel Lambayeque y además posee una mototaxi.
E monto solicitado del Crédito será de 3000 nuevos soles y será para invertirlo en compra de planchas de  eternit para techo de su domicilio y para realizar mantenimiento  y compra de SOAT de su  mototaxi de  su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Margarita is 37 years old and lives with her partner and their two dependent children in her own house, in PPJJ Las Dunas, within the district of Lambayeque. She only has valid credit with our entity.
Margarita offers custom sewing services from a workshop, which operates in her residence. She owns a manual sewing machine and an overlocker, which she acquired with the last loan granted by our entity. She is well known in her area and has a loyal customer base.
Her spouse works as a guard for the UGEL (Local Education Management Unit) of Lambayeque, and he also owns a mototaxi.
The loan amount requested will be 3000 nuevos soles, which will be invested in the purchase of fiber cement sheets for the roof of their home, and in maintenance and purchase of insurance for her spouse's mototaxi.

loans.use: to purchase fiber cement sheets for home improvement, and to maintain and purchase insurance for her mototaxi.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La señora Justina nació en Andahuaylillas,  tiene 72 años de edad, todos dedicados al campo y a la crianza de animales. Ella está casada y tiene 5 hijos adultos.

La actividad de la señora Justina es la venta de chicha de jora en su domicilio y la crianza de animales menores tales como cuyes y gallinas y precisamente ella necesita un préstamo para comprar mas animales y seguir con su comercio.

Justina pertenece al banco comunal ”LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
texts.en:
Justina was born in Andahuaylillas and has lived 72 years, all of them dedicated to the fields and raising animals.  She is married and has 5 adult children.  Her work is the sale of chicha de jora (a traditional alcoholic beverage) from her home and raising small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.  Right now, she needs a loan to purchase more animals and continue with her business.

Justina belongs to the communal bank ”LAS TRIUNFADORAS” which is located in the Andahuaylillas district in the Quispicanchis province in the department of Cusco.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Melvin

texts.en:
Melvin is married with two children. Melvin is 34 years old.

To earn a living, Melvin has a habal-habal or motorela business. Melvin has had this business for three years.  Melvin has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Melvin hopes to improve his business to support his family and give them a better life.

loans.use: to buy motor parts, maintenance and gasoline for his motorcycle

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 49 years old, married and lives in the Philippines.
  
Jovelyn has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 4,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Jovelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Jovelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda. For the past two years, Hamida has been working hard to manage her small business selling paper bags. 

To help expand her business, Hamida has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more paper for making bags and will help Hamida to generate greater profits and pay her own school fees. Hamida hopes that in the future, she will be able to complete her studies. 

Hamida is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Hamida's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more paper for making bags,

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Gloria has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 6,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Gloria has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Gloria hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of canned goods, snacks, soap and beverages

loans.name: Hilder's Group

texts.en:
Hilder's group is comprised of 2 hardworking women. Hilder is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala east region of Uganda. Hilder has been working hard to manage her small business, selling snacks. 

To help expand her business, Hilder has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase cooking oil, and will help Hilder to generate greater profits and pay her own school fees. Hilder hopes that, in the future, she will be able to become a doctor, if possible. 

Hilder is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Hilder's future prospects by helping her to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
La socia Olinda sigue participando en el banco comunal “Virgen Estrella de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella sigue dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo pollos. Con el anterior préstamo ella  pudo incrementar el capital del negocio y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más pollos. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Olinda is a member who continues to participate in the Communal Bank "Virgen Estrella de Oropesa” with Asociación Arariwa. She still raises small animals, such as chickens. With her previous loan, she was able to increase her business capital. For this opportunity, she needs a loan to buy more chickens.

She is pleased with this loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
La socia Ana Cecilia sigue participando en el banco comunal “Virgen Estrella de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa, ella sigue dedicándose a la agricultura siembra papa, maíz, cebada y otras cosas. Con el anterior préstamo ella pudo incrementar el capital del negocio y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizante. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Ana Cecilia continues participating in the “Virgen Estrella de Oropesa” community bank of the Arariwa Association.  She continues working in agriculture, planting potatos, corn, barley and other crops.  With the previous loan, she was able to increase the capital of her business and at this opportunity, she requests the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer.  She is happy for the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is married with nine children. Angeline is 62 years old.

Angelina sells and buys bananas and coconuts to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Angelina has requested a loan to buy additional stock of bananas and coconuts to sell.

Angelina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Angelina hopes to improve her business to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of bananas and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Mekdad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married and has two children.

Mekdad is a carpenter. In 2005, he opened his carpentry workshop, making bedrooms, living rooms and doors. He has sufficient experience in this field a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a loan of $2100 to purchase an electrical generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase an electrical generator.

loans.name: Munzi

texts.en: Munzi is a 40-year-old woman married to a casual labourer. She has eight children with ages ranging from 3 years to 19 years. She describes herself as aggressive, creative and organized. She farms and sells goats and bricks. She has been involved in this business for 13 years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high cost of transportation for delivering bricks to customers. She will use this 30,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy goats and building bricks. Munzi's dream and business goal is to be selling goats and cows.

loans.use: to buy building blocks and goats for selling.

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyungerel, 49, has been the manager of a private company since 2009. She is divorced and now lives alone in her apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter lives apart from her with her husband.

Oyungerel is a water engineer, but has not yet found employment in her field. She owns a car and she uses it for a taxi business in the evenings after her job hours. She says that it is very important and beneficial to make savings for her future life. Oyungerel's car is becoming old and unreliable. Therefore she is requesting a loan to purchase some spare parts to repair it.

loans.use: To purchase some spare parts to repair her car.

loans.name: Marine

texts.ru:
На протяжении 12 лет Марине занимается сельскохозяйственным бизнесом в деревне Арачадзор (Arajadzor). На своем участке она выращивает картофель, чеснок, фасоль, яблоки, корольки, гранаты и инжир. Выращенные овощи и фрукты Марине продает в городе Капане и таким образом обеспечивает большую часть потребностей своей семьи. 
Сумма кредита в размере 900.000 драм необходима Марине для приобретения баков для воды и проведения оросительной системы для поливки своего участка. На данный момент она поливает свой участок, пользуясь за определенную плату оросительной системой своих соседей. Часть кредита Марине потратит на покупку яблочных и гранатовых саженцев для своего бизнеса.
Марине 48 лет. Она замужем и у нее двое детей: сын и дочь, которые живут вместе с родителями. Параллельно с ведение сельскохозяйственного бизнеса, Марине работает архитектором. Семья Марине помогает ей в выращивании овощей и фруктов.
texts.en:
Marine has been involved in an agricultural business in the village of Arajadzor for 12 years. On her plot she grows potatoes, garlic, beans, apples, blood oranges, pomegranites, and figs. Marine sells the vegetables and fruit that she grow in the city of Kapane; this provides for a large portion of her family's needs.

Marine needs a loan of 900 drami to buy water tanks and install an irrigation system for watering her plot. Currently she pays her neighbors to use their irrigation system for watering. Marine will also use a portion of the loan to buy apple and pomegranite seedlings for her business.

Marine is 48 years old. She is married and has two children: a son and a daughter who live with their parents. Along with running her argicultural business, Marine also works as an architect. Marine's family helps her with growing the vegetables and fruit.

loans.use: To buy water tank, to lay irrigation system and to buy apple and pomegranate trees' seedlings as well

loans.name: Vandadsuren

texts.en:
Mrs. Vandadsuren, 38, sells women's casual clothes in the shopping mall. She has been running her business since 2007 with one rental stall, and it is the main source of income for her family. Vandadsuren's 2 sons both attend primary school and their school fees are very expensive. She lives with her 2 sons in her small house in the ger district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Vandadsuren's sales volume increases notably every spring and summer. It is a good opportunity for her business to earn more money. Vandadsuren is requesting a loan to purchase spring and summer casual clothes from her suppliers in large numbers. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to increasing her working capital to increase her sales volume.

loans.use: to purchase spring and summer casual clothes in large numbers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase soap, cooking oil, biscuits, bananas, and other goods to sell

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
La Sra. Valentina ahora tiene 37 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de gallinas y también se dedica a vender pasto, infusiones y huevo sancochado en forma ambulatoria en el mercado de Andahuaylillas. 
En esta oportunidad Valentina solicita un préstamo para comprar gallinas y mejorar su negocio. La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
Valentina pertenece al banco comunal “LAS TRIUNFADORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Andahuaylillas, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
texts.en:
Valentina is now 37 years old, in a common law marriage and has 4 children.  She alternates her daily tasks with her business raising chickens and she also sells grass, herbal teas, and boiled eggs as a traveling merchant in the Andahuaylillas market. 

At this opportunity, Valentina requests the loan to purchase chickens and improve her business.  She is happy for the loan and promises to make her payments.  Valentina belongs to the “LAS TRIUNFADORAS” community bank, located in the Andahuaylillas district, belonging to the Quispicanchis province in the department of Cusco.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Jovelita

texts.en:
Jovelita is 36 years old, single and lives in the Philippines. 

Jovelita has a shop that sells seafood like fish and seaweed. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy fish like milk fish, sardines and flying fish.

Jovelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Jovelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish to sell

loans.name: Yoleny

texts.es: La Sra Yoleny es una mujer de 65 años,quien se ha dedicado a la venta de cosmeticos y articulos de catálogo desde hace muchos años, siendo cliente de la fundación se le ha apoyado con varios créditos en los cuales se ha caracterizado por tener una exelente moral de pago. Con el crédito anterior que se le otorgó con fondos de Kiva ella pudo financiar la compra de mercadería , y así pagar algunos gastos de medicinas para su hijo que estaba enfermo. Doña Yoleny es una mujer muy trabajadora y siempre solidaria con sus familia, ella procura apoyar a sus hijos en lo que le sea posible, pero también disfruta su trabajo , y las gananacias le permiten tener una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en: Yoleny is a 65 year old women who has worked many years in the sale of cosmetics and catalog products.  As a client of the foundation, she has been supported with various loans, in which she has been characterized by her excellent record of payment.  With the previous loan that she received from Kiva funds, she was able to finance the purchase of merchandise and thus pay some medical expenses for her son who was sick.  Yoleny is a very hard-working woman and always supportive of her family.  She supports her children in every way possible, but also enjoys her work and the income allows her to have a good quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a case of perfume.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a 52-year-old married woman with two children, one child is enrolled in school. 

Mwanakombo operates a food stall, which is located at the market centre. She has been in this business for 1 year, and she aspires to open a restaurant in the future. Mwanakombo lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She joined Yehu to access funds, and she describes market competition to be her major challenge. 

With the loan of 10,000 KES, she will be able to add stock of rice and wheat flour to her food stall.

loans.use: to add stock of rice and wheat flour to her food stall.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Las Emprendedoras, fue formado  hace mas de 1 año,  por 12 señoras muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras .Ellas se encuentran muy contentas por formar parte del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya y desean seguir creciendo en sus proyectos.
Susana es una de las miembros del grupo, ella se dedica al comercio, tiene una despensa bien surtida, la cual con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha podido llevar adelante. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y de esa manera seguir ayudando a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, enlatados, embutidos, y demás insumos, con los cuales podrá seguir ofreciendo buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Las Emprendedoras” (The Entrepreneurs) committee was formed over a year ago by 12 very hardworking, enterprising women.  They are very happy to be part of Fundación Paraguaya’s enterprising women program and want to continue growing with their projects.

Susana is one of the group members.  She’s a merchant.  She has a well-stocked grocery store that with much sacrifice and effort she’s been carrying forward.  Her goal is to continue growing and helping her family by this means.

She requests the loan to buy beverages, dairy products, canned goods, cured meats and other supplies to continue providing a good variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Vedaste

texts.en:
Vedaste is 35 years old and is married with two children. He sells various goods, such as lotions, cakes, soap, cooking oil, etc. in his store. His store is open from 10 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day except on Saturday. He currently employs three people to help him. He has 2 years of experience in this work. 

Vedaste has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods, such as lotions, cakes, soap, cooking oil, etc. to sell. With the profit, he expects to save money for his future to reinvest in his business and to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase various goods, such as lotions, cakes, soap, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Batdorj

texts.en: Batdorj, 52, has been running a clothes selling business with his wife since 1995. At night he operates a taxi around town, which helps greatly to increase his family's monthly earnings. Batdorj lives with his wife and daughter in a shared apartment. His car is an old car to use for a taxi business, and lately it has been running poorly. This influences his service quality and business earnings for the worse, so Batdorj has decided he would like to buy spare parts for car repair. It will cost about 2,700,000 MNT. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to repairing his car.

loans.use: to repair his taxi car.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is 29 years old and lives in the town of Soroti in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past 6 years, Juma has been working hard to manage his small business, which does carpentry. 

To help expand his business, Juma has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more wood for making beds for resale, and will help Juma to generate greater profits and make more furniture. Juma hopes that in the future he will be able to borrow  more money again after completing. 

Juma is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Juma who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more wood for making beds for resale.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 38 years old and lives in the town of Soroti in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children. Two of his children are currently in school. For the past 16 years, David has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, David has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like soap and sugar for resale and will help David to generate greater profits and expand his business. David hopes that in the future he will be able to become a wholeseller. 

David is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like David who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like soap and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a 40-year-old married man with four children, aged between three and 19 years old. He describes himself as a man who is ambitious, courageous and a go-getter. He operates a retail business selling animals such as goats, chickens, and ducks. Michael has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs one staff member. His business is strategically located and his primary customers are butchers and farmers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be outbreak of diseases. Michael will use the Kes 20,000 loan to pay for the construction of a house for his chickens. Michael's dream and business goal is to be a dairy farmer and supplier of milk.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a chicken house.

loans.name: Walter Mauricio

texts.es:
Walter es un hombre muy trabajador a sus 40 años de edad el tiene una alegría de un joven de 20 años, es padre de familia y junto a su esposa quiere y ama a sus 2 hijos los cuales tienen 16 y 8 años de edad , por los cuales trabaja de sol a sol por sacarlos adelante para verlos felices y con una buena calidad de vida, su vivienda se ubica en el distrito de Parcona, Ica, Perú, el distrito de Parcona se caracteriza por la amabilidad de sus pobladores así como también por poseer el bosque de piedras, el cual es un conjunto  Cerros en formas de animales, personas, entre otros. Como buen peruano le gusta mucho la comida típica de nuestro país, por ello su platillo favorito es la riquísima Sopa Seca. Debido a los pocos recursos de sus padres Walter solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Derecho.

Día a día Walter trabaja en su negocio como maestro de construcción, trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 2 clientes al día según el tipo y tamaño de construcción que realice; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque realiza un buen trabajo y es muy responsable con los clientes.

Walter está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoramientos en su vivienda y podrá comprar los útiles escolares para sus hijos, con esta mejora el podrá ofrecerle una mejor vivienda a su familia y sus hijos podrán tener los útiles necesarios para ir a la escuela; así el podrá seguir luchando día a día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia
texts.en:
Walter is a very hardworking man who at the age of 40 has the joy of a twenty-year-old.  He’s a father and together with his wife loves his two children who are 16 and 8 years old.  He works sunrise to sunrise in order to move them forward and to see them happy with a good quality of life.  

His house is located in Parcona District in Ica, Perú.  Parcona District is noted for the kindness of its inhabitants but also for the Stone Forest which is a collection of hills in the shape of animals and persons, among others.  Like all good Peruvians he enjoys our country’s typical food very much and his favorite dish is the very delicious “sopa seca.” Due to his parents’ scarce resources, Walter was only able to finish fifth year of secondary school but he would have liked to have studied Law.

Walter works day to day in his business as a master builder.  He works about 8 hours per day and can take care of up to two customers per day according to the type and size of the construction job he does.  He believes that he does well in his business because he does good work and is very responsible with his customers.

Walter is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve provided him he will be able to do some improvements to his house and buy his children’s school supplies.  With this improvement he will be able to provide a better home for his family and his children will have the necessary supplies to go to school and he will be able to continue striving day to day to make his greatest dream a reality:  “To have a house of his own.”

loans.use: to do some home improvements and to buy school supplies.

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina is 34 years old and is married with five children between 8 and 17 years old. She sells cows and she has been in this business for eight years. She currently employs four people to help her, and her business is open from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. all week except in the weekend. 

Elina has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her cow-breeding business. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, to reinvest in her business, and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to expand her cow breeding business.

loans.name: Celina

texts.es:
Celina es una mujer muy entusiasta y sobre todo valiente , es madre de un pequeño de 2 años de edad al cual cría sola ya que es madre soltera y desde que nació se convirtió en madre y padre para su hijo y por lo cual trabaja con mucho esfuerzo para ver a su hijo hecho una persona de bien y sobre todo feliz; su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Camana, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener unas playas hermosas, un clima cálido, por su agricultura , en especial el cultivo de arroz y también por su pesca y sobre todo por los exquisitos Camarones. Como buena peruana le gusta mucho la comida y su plato favorito es el riquísimo “Pollo al Vino, asimismo cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mirar películas para distraerse un poco.

Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación Celina trabaja en su negocio de crianza y venta de cerdos, ella trabaja alrededor de 12 horas al día y puede atender hasta 10 clientes en el día sobre todo cuando son días festivos ya que los clientes en estas fechas consumen mas carne de cerdo; ella cree que l va bien en su negocio porque es muy trabajadora y porque atiende de manera amable a los clientes.

Celina está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar alimentos balanceados para los cerdos así como también realizar mejoras al corral donde cría a los cerdos; con esta mejora podrá seguir dándole una buena alimentación a los animales y criarlos en un espacio apropiado, así los clientes sentirán más confianza y seguirán comprando sus productos, con lo cual Celina seguirá luchando día a día para hacer cumplir su más grande sueño.” Darle una buena educación a su hijo y una vida feliz”.
texts.en:
Celina is an enthusiastic but above all brave woman.  She’s the mother of a little two year old boy who she raises by herself since she’s a single mother and since he was born she became both mother and father for her son; she works with much effort to see her son become an upstanding citizen and above all to be happy.

Her house is located in the city of Camana, a city noted for having beautiful beaches, hot climate, for its agriculture especially rice growing, and also for its fishing and above all for its delicious shrimp.  Like all good Peruvian women she enjoys food very much and her favorite dish is the very delicious “Pollo al Vino.”  When she has free time she likes to watch movies to entertain herself a little.

With much effort and dedication, Celina works raising pigs to sell.  She works about 12 hours daily and can tend to up to 10 customers per day especially during feast days because customers consume more pork on those occasions.  She believes that she does well in her business because she’s very hardworking and because she treats her customers very kindly.

Celina is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they have given her she will be able to buy nutritionally balanced pig feed as well as to make some improvements to the corral where she keeps the pigs.  With this improvement she will be able to continue to provide good nutrition to the animals and raise them in an appropriate space so that customers will be more inclined to buy her products so that Celina can continue striving day to day to reach her greatest dream:  “To give her son a good education and a happy life.”

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed and to repair her corral.

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr:
Madame Seynabou est une dame de 42 ans qui fait du commerce depuis 5 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle vend des produits alimentaires tels que le poisson fumé et séché, de l’huile de palme. Elle se ravitaille dans un marché hebdomadaire ou une variété de produits sont offertes. Elle vend aussi du savon artisanal comme on voit sur la photo.Elle sollicite un crédit de 100000F CFA  pour honorer une commande.
Seynabou n’a pas de charges  sinon ces charges personnelles. Elle travaille pour améliorer les conditions alimentaires de son foyer.
texts.en:
Madame Seynabou is 42 years old, and has been selling food for 5 years. She is married and has a family. Seynabou sells products such as smoked and dried fish, and palm oil. She obtains her supplies at a weekly market where she can find a variety of products. She also sells home-made soap, as seen in the photo. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 CFA francs to be able to fill an order.
Seynabou has no other financial responsibilities besides her own expenses. She works in order to provide more food for her family.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish, palm oil, and dried fish.

loans.name: Tecla

texts.es:
La  Sra. Tecla es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, ella tiene una despensa y nos comenta que trabaja en esto hace más de 12 años, por lo que ya tiene un buen conocimiento sobre este negocio.
Ella nos comenta que tiene una gran  clientela formada  y que es  la única despensa del barrio; es un verdadero sacrificio  ya que madruga para realizar sus compras; de esta manera abaratar el costo de sus productos y obtener menores ganancias. Ella se define como una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, que siempre se esfuerza por salir adelante. Tecla, con este trabajo logro mejorar su vivienda y darle la educación necesaria a sus hijos.
Ella necesita de este crédito para la compra  de carne, pollo, gaseosas, lácteos, panificados y demás insumos que necesita para poder surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Tecla is from the city of San Lorenzo.  She has a grocery store and she tells us that she’s been in business for more than 12 years so she has good knowledge of this business.

She comments that she has an established good clientele and that it’s the only grocery store in the neighborhood.  It’s quite a sacrifice because she must rise at dawn to do her purchases so that she can lower her costs and be able to make higher profits. 

She defines herself as a very hardworking, tenacious woman who always strives to get ahead.  Through her work, Tecla has managed to make some home improvements and provide her children with the necessary schooling.

She needs this loan to buy meat, chicken, soft-drinks, dairy products, baked goods and other supplies she needs to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El comité Divino Niño Jesus se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.  Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes,  pero también hacen actividades en conjunto para poder fomentar su compañerismo. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de trabajar juntas para lograr sus metas.
La Señora Romualda es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica a elaborar helados y vender, también vende comidas en lo que le va muy bien.  Ella ya no tiene hijos chicos y su marido es pintor de autos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, condimentos, panificados y demás insumos, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y vendiendo los alimentos que hace. Agradece la oportunidad que están recibiendo, pues le será de mucha ayuda
texts.en:
The “Divino Niño Jesús” (Divine Child Jesus) committee formed thanks to several neighbors from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso.  All the members of the committee carry out their independent activities but they also do group activities to foster their fellowship.  The members formed a very united group that’s capable of working together to reach their goals.

Romualda is one of the committee members.  She makes frozen treats to sell and also sells food; she does very well.  She does not have minor children and her husband paints cars.
